FlavorTextOption.Text: We are reasonable and open to new deals. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Trade)[/COLOR]
[I]Hold some precious items out to the screen.[/I] [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Trade)[/COLOR]
Let's see what you think of making some deals. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Trade)[/COLOR]
No trade happens in my empire without my approval. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Trade)[/COLOR]
We are open to trade, as long as it benefits the citizens of our empire. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Trade)[/COLOR]
For the right price we might be willing to trade with you. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Trade)[/COLOR]
Through fair trade both of our empires can benefit. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Trade)[/COLOR]
Our markets are the envy of the galaxy. Let us see how yours compare. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Trade)[/COLOR]
Perhaps we can interest you in some aesthetically pleasing ordering of 0's and 1's? [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Trade)[/COLOR]

Another race is nearing [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Ascension[/COLOR]. We do not know what lies beyond mortality, or what it means to follow the path of the precursors. But if they succeed, the prize will be theirs alone to claim. And we will be become little more than dust in the corners of the galaxy they leave us.[BR][BR]If we want to have any chance of ruling the galaxy, their attempt must be stopped.
Let's review victory status. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens the Victory screen)[/COLOR]

Another civilization is nearing a [HS=HS_Prestige]Prestige Victory[/HS]. When the story of our galaxy is written the scholars will remark that they dominated this age, and we will be little more than a minor footnote.[BR][BR]If we want to have our legacy remembered we must act now.
Let's review victory status. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens the Victory screen)[/COLOR]
Warm greetings, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. We do not know whether you are friend or foe. Only time can answer that. For now, we bid you peace.
So you are the {PLAYERFACTION:2}. Rumors have reached us of your kind. We will see soon whether you are a friend or an enemy.
I am told that you are called, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. This is very interesting to us. Whether we are destined to cooperate or seek mutual extermination remains to be seen.
Another potential slave race. We are always glad to meet new volunteers.
The galaxy seems to be filled with talking meat, {PLAYERFACTION:2}.
A pleasure to meet you. I do hope we can get this relationship off to a good start.
Hello preymeat. Have you come to present yourself for consumption by the Festron? Good. Goooood.
Salutations, travelers. Please let us proceed with opening conversational maneuvers.
Hello, hopefully not too villainous alien. We are the Mimot Brotherhood, and we are delighted to see you, and we are not delicious.
Another simple-minded alien, I presume. Twisted by your own childish sense of morality. Well. Let's not let that get between us.
Speak openly, alien, so that we might know you friend or foe.
We see hope in your eyes at this encounter. That will pass.
Your life, as you know it, is now over. Soon, you will be our slaves.
A new being. What a delight! No fear yet. The fire still in your eyes. Oh how fast that will change.
Greetings, and welcome. Our civilization has flourished for thousands of years. We know of powers that you cannot even imagine.
More fleshlings. I don't understand the concept of how meat can become sentient.
Before we begin to speak, stranger, I should tell you that my people will never be slaves again. Let us converse with that fact known.
You, alien. Are you the ones we fear and hate? The ones who stole our children? Or are you better? Or worse?
It's always a blessing meeting someone who has not yet found the way of the Krynn. It will be my pleasure to watch you come to understand the truth that we do.
Alien, know this: we were ancient when the universe was new. But we are now only a dim shadow of what we once were.
We are the true heirs of Altar. You will not stand in our way.
A pleasure to make your acquaintance. Let's all do our best to make this a mutually profitable encounter.
Greeting unhived, one. Why do you cross our viewports today?
Your mind reflects the changing nature of your chaotic form.
Are you yet another animal? The galaxy is teaming with you. How interesting.

Greetings! The Advance is always happy to make contact with a new group. We are excited to formally connect.[BR][BR]We are all guided by the same stars in the vast expanse of space. Let's chase the light and create a bright future together.
Greetings, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. {LEADERNAME:1}'s primary duty is to wipe you from the galaxy... Oh, and thanks for the Hyperdrive. It will make hunting you down that much easier.
At last we meet the {PLAYERFACTION:2}. I am {LEADERNAME:1}. We are powerful and you would be wise to respect our power.
Ah, the fabled {PLAYERFACTION:2}. Greetings from {LEADERNAME:1}. We've heard tales of your kind. Let's see if they hold true.
Stars align, and finally we cross paths with the {PLAYERFACTION:2}. I am {LEADERNAME:1}. Let our futures be intertwined in either harmony or doom.
Oh, the {PLAYERFACTION:2}! At last, a face to the name. And such a face it is. I am {LEADERNAME:1}. Mind your business and stay out of our territory.
The {PLAYERFACTION:2} have traversed the void to face us. I am {LEADERNAME:1}. Our spores have spread far, and yours is a new scent to us.
Gazes from across the galaxy fall upon the {PLAYERFACTION:2}. This is {LEADERNAME:1}. Our tendrils stretch far; intertwine with us wisely.
The cosmic winds whispered of the {PLAYERFACTION:2}. Here you are. I am {LEADERNAME:1}. Our songs vibrate across star clusters; heed our melody or face dissonance.
Through the vast black, the {PLAYERFACTION:2} emerge. I, {LEADERNAME:1}, have waited eons. Our cores pulse with energy; align with us or risk eruption.
The shimmering void reveals the {PLAYERFACTION:2}. I am known as {LEADERNAME:1}. Our scales have shielded us from cosmic tempests; approach with caution lest you feel our bite.
Space bends, and the {PLAYERFACTION:2} materialize. Greet {LEADERNAME:1}. Our minds span dimensions; connect with grace or face our disconnection.
The stars unveil the {PLAYERFACTION:2}. Witness {LEADERNAME:1}. Our wings blot out suns; soar with us or plummet into the abyss.
Galactic ripples announce the {PLAYERFACTION:2}. You face {LEADERNAME:1}. Our roots drink from cosmic wells; nourish our bond or wither in the void.
The ether trembles, the {PLAYERFACTION:2} approach. Stand before {LEADERNAME:1}. Our maws hunger for new experiences; feed our curiosity or be consumed.
Celestial bodies align, showing us the {PLAYERFACTION:2}. Bow to {LEADERNAME:1}. Our eyes see realms unknown; gaze with us or be blinded by our might.
We are the illustrious {PLAYERFACTION:1}. Know us and feel the weight of galaxies in our gaze. I am {LEADERNAME:1}, keeper of stars.
The vast expanse has whispered tales of {PLAYERFACTION:2}. Now, under the watchful eyes of {LEADERNAME:1}, we see if the whispers were true.
Before you stands {LEADERNAME:1} of the unparalleled {PLAYERFACTION:1}. Our shadow stretches across constellations. Cross us, and you'll feel our cosmic wrath.
The {PLAYERFACTION:2} dare to tread where legends walk. With {LEADERNAME:1} as our beacon, we decide if you'll be ally or another footnote in our story.
Behold the majesty of the {PLAYERFACTION:1}, under the stewardship of {LEADERNAME:1}. The very nebulas pause to honor our grandeur. Will you?
The universe's heartbeat synchronizes with the {PLAYERFACTION:1}. I, {LEADERNAME:1}, bear the rhythm. Match our tempo or be lost in the cosmic cacophony.
From black holes to supernovae, nothing shines brighter than {PLAYERFACTION:1}. As {LEADERNAME:1} stands before you, ponder â€” will you be a beacon with us or merely a flicker?
Galaxies have risen and fallen, yet the {PLAYERFACTION:1} remain, steadfast and eternal. I am {LEADERNAME:1}. Challenge our eternity at your peril.
The cosmic tapestry weaves tales of {PLAYERFACTION:2}. Under the vigilant gaze of {LEADERNAME:1}, we'll see if your threads strengthen or tangle the narrative.
Endless cycles, countless civilizations, but none like {PLAYERFACTION:1}. Led by {LEADERNAME:1}, we're the lighthouse in the cosmic void. Sail towards us, or risk the abyss.
A pleasure to meet you. I do hope we can get this relationship off to a good start.
Jesus Christ, what the hell are you?[BR][BR]You look absolutely monstrous. Sorry, sorry. I was just not expecting something out of my nightmares. Our diplomatic team will clean this up. How are you?
It is good to see you again. We hope we can unite the humans again under a single banner.
We welcome you to what we hope will one day be a united galaxy.
You are absolutely too cute to be real.
Based on your looks we must have a common evolutionary ancestor. We should meet and discuss this.
We are always happy to meet the Arcean civilization. We hope together we can build a better future.
The mighty Drengin Empire is once again on the move. Know that we will keeping a close eye on you.
We are delighted to meet what many here believe is a related species. We hope to work together with you for the betterment of the galaxy.
Ah, the robotic species known as {PLAYERFACTION:2}. We hope to work with you. If not, we will dismantle you.
We are glad to have had a small part in freeing you from the malevolent Drengin Empire. Now your destiny is in our hands.
You are the first space lobsters we've met.[BR][BR]Do not fear our terminology for it is scientific because I used the word space in front of lobster.
We have heard much of your civilization. We have studied a great deal of your lore and history.[BR][BR]Let me be the first to say "Live long and prosper."
Wonderful, a new market! The {PLAYERFACTION:1} look forward to serving... whatever you are.
Despite you looking quite menacing, we nevertheless hope that we can work together to build a friendship that will span the galaxy.
Hel-looo. Can you hear me? Hmmm, I don't see any ears.[BR][BR](Why is it always the weird ones we meet?)
...Sorry, I'm not sure which eye I'm supposed to look at. Those are eyes, right?
May our eggs find your many orifices
Your worm like bodies will make excellent hosts.
Your fur will make excellent hiding places for my eggs.
Your form is worthless to us. Only biological entities can store our eggs.
Worthless species! How can you serve the Festron if there is no biological mass to lay our eegs in?[BR][BR](Hard-bodied waste of my time.)
Haven't we used your carcasses before?
Salutations, travelers. Please let us proceed with opening conversational maneuvers. You may have discovered Hyperdrive but we discovered subspace streams.
We are pleased to meet another species, even one as adorable as you.
I assume you are the machine servant for an unseen master? Can you send for them?
Of all the timid species of the universe you alone knew the Precursors. It is tragic that you have lost their memory.
We travel the universe as explorers. But we are also traders. We are happy to meet you.
As explorers of the universe, we are ecstatic to bridge the gap between our sectors.[BR][BR](A good friendship here might give us an advantage in understanding the new sector.)
This meeting marks some of the farthest-flung sentient life we've ever encountered. Having explored for so long, we thought we knew all the space-faring races.
Hello, hopefully not too villainous alien. We are the Mimot Brotherhood, and we are delighted to see you, and we are not delicious.
You look a lot like one of the species that evolved on our world. They were nice. They're dead now.
We hope we can be friends.
I have the distinct feeling that things are not going to end well in our dealings.
We remember your civilization well. You were the ones who traded our people to the Drengin for their amusement and food needs.
How strange! Last I saw something like you, I lost an entire wardrobe and had to fumigate an entire freighter.

Ah, the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} graces us with their presence. No doubt you wish to push your limited morality onto us as well. You will find us a lot more challenging to deal with than the [HS=HS_Xendar]Xendar[/HS], human.

Well, if it isn't a {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} seeking our audience! Let me guess, you came to polish our boots with your high and mighty morals? Sorry to disappoint, mate, but we're a tougher shell to crack than your [HS=HS_Xendar]Xendar[/HS] pals.

Oh, a visitor from the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2}. How quaint! Have you arrived to enlighten us with your narrow views of right and wrong? Brace yourself, human. We are not your [HS=HS_Xendar]Xendar[/HS], and we're not easily swayed.
Ah, a {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} beacon in our void. Starry-eyed, peddling your flimsy sense of justice? You've met the [HS=HS_Xendar]Xendar[/HS], now meet your match, human.
How unexpected, a {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} emissary! Here to peddle your simplistic sense of good and evil? You've got it all wrong, human. We're not your [HS=HS_Xendar]Xendar[/HS] playthings.

Well, look what the cosmic tide washed in, a {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} representative! Don't tell me, you're here to impose your black and white morality? Against us, human, your usual tricks won't do. We're not the [HS=HS_Xendar]Xendar[/HS] you've danced with before.
A disgusting bug creature. The universe could not be more ironic.
Space worms. Of course it would be a space worms.
We have pests like you on our home world. They may look cute but they are dangerous and deadly.
We have droids that look more useful than you.
Ah we are familiar with your species. You may find our way of doing business a little dangerous but in time you will appreciate the margins.
Praytell, have you moved beyond the petty barriers of 'moral' and 'immoral' in your distant galaxies?[BR][BR](Hmmm, what could I call these rock-made creatures that'd be amusing?)
Careful, silk-eater, you are playing with fire. Mind your tongue and distance or burn.
We continue to be grateful for your discovery of hyperdrive.
Ah so the Precursor's minions have returned to our area of space at last.[BR][BR]Something very dark must have driven your kind to cooperate together to this extent.
Our old rivals. We look forward to continuing to see who will dominate this galaxy.
You are the species that nearly wiped out the Iconians after the Precursor war. We respect that.
Your civilization has come far over these past centuries. We are glad that we taught you to build a stargate.
So you're a human. The ones who created the Hyperdrive technology. It will be a pleasure to meet you and have you for dinner.
We will show you mercy because you have discovered subspace streams.
We are glad to find your kind out in the wild. The nutty taste of your flesh is not quite the same as the ones grown on our farms.
You are practically ready to be cooked.
Ahh, you are the race with the same soft skin as the humans. Are you as dangerous as they are, I wonder?
So the rumors are true. There is a powerful species of murderbots in the universe. We respect that.
Have you returned to our area of the galaxy in the hopes to become our slaves again?
So the religious fanatics have made it to our part of space.
Ah to meet one of your kind face to face at last.[BR][BR]You no longer hide behind third-party agents. Good. The galactic peddlers will face our wrath if you attempt to swindle us.

You'd do well to surrender yourselves to our chains. As slaves, your kind would find great purpose in the glory of our empire.[BR][BR](They look harder to break than bone, but they'll break all the same.)
Our prophecies foretold of this meeting, cousin. The mystery of our similar appearances may soon be unraveled.
We will not judge you based on how different you appear but rather on your actions.
You are all together new to us. We have great hope that we can exist together peacefully.
We hope to learn more about your delightful civilization.
Your reputation precedes you. We wish only for peace, for whatever that's worth to you.
We value all life, no matter what form it takes.
A pleasure to make your acquaintance. We trust you greet us with similarly peaceful intentions.
We have heard from legends that your race was lost after your service to the Precursors. We are glad to see that those legends were wrong.
It's always a pleasure to meet a potential new friend. We look forward to normalizing relations between our peoples.

Greetings. I hope your time in this section of space has been peaceful. Please let me know if the Altarian Republic can do anything for you.[BR][BR](They look oddly similar. Perhaps they are an early version of us left by the Precursors.)
Though I've no reason for this, I suspect there is much we can share and friendships we can forge.
Another example of talking meat. You actually flap a piece of meat to create sounds. Disgusting.
Your species may be something we can work with.
There were rumors that your species had recently organized to form a galactic civilization.[BR][BR]We are skeptical that you did this out of pure chance.
Nothing could have evolved that appears as you that doesn't have an ulterior motive.
We never expected to see your kind again.
We have little need for a species that exists merely to act as a conduit of goods and services for others.
Analyzing physical capability to retain and transport a charge as a form of new energy.[BR][BR]([I]No thought can be detected.[/I])
Before we begin to speak, stranger, I should tell you that my people will never be slaves again. Let us converse with that fact known. If we find the Drengin, we will have our vengeance.
We were slaves of the evil Drengin Empire. We hope you are wary of them if you come into contact with them.
At last, we have found you. Driving you from our homeworld was only the first step on the road to annihilating you.
We have not forgotten how you used to sell the processed oils and bone of our people that the Drengin murdered to the minor civilizations in this sector.

I wonder -are you friend or foe? Since encountering other species, we've been battered and enslaved, but we have survived. We will not be turned to food, fuel, and labor again.[BR][BR](I've seen enough of my kind imprisoned and tortured. Never again ...never.)
Ah, we have heard rumors of the civilization that first invented the FTL device known as hyperdrive. We hope to learn more about you.
We are positively delighted to meet you. We are quickly expanding across the galaxy and hoping to make new friends.
You are a creature unknown to us. We will reserve judgement for now.
You are a new face. An interesting one at that. This sector has taken much from us, and we could use some allies to help find answers.
Ah, a new alien. Have you embraced THE WAY?
Your kind can still be uplifted by THE WAY.
We are a species that believes in a universal harmony. All civilizations will one day see this harmony or else.[BR][BR]We can see in your eyes that you will one day join us.
Extreme profit is a sin to our civilization. In time we will teach you THE WAY and you will find salvation.
Come, seekers of light. Come, harbingers of harmony. Join us in celebrating the bright, the dark, and the divine.
Human, know this: we were ancient when the universe was new. But we are now only a dim shadow of what we once were. Our own robotic creations known as The Yor, rose up and took our homeworld.

It has been more than an age since we have encountered your kind. In the days when the Precursors strove the galaxy like giants we remember you with them.[BR][BR]Your kind always worked individually. Never before have you had any interest in gathering like this. We will find the reason.
We have learned in the dark years of our exile that things with large eyes cannot be trusted.
Ah the brutal Drengin Empire has returned to this part of space. You will find that we have little patience for species bent on conquest.
So at long last we meet again. We will take back our homeworld from you.
We are glad to meet you directly and not through your agents.[BR][BR]Your terraforming technology allowed us to burn out the native inhabitants of New Iconia.

Your kind is not one I recognize. We, who had given rise to the Yor and watched as the worlds around us established space travel after us, have never seen you. Far you have traveled, but to what end, I wonder.
You -the Precursors never mentioned your kind. How is it now you emerge from distant galaxies with tools of destruction?[BR][BR](Is there more the Precursors hid from us?)
You look like the beings who exiled us from our native planet. We will not suffer the same fate again.
Our legends tell of a species that traveled with the Arnor when we still lived on our first world. We never thought we would meet.
Your appearance almost seems like something out of a dream.
So the tainted Altarians have finally made it into the larger galaxy.[BR][BR]Know that we will eventually return to our homeworld that you stole from us.
You look like an abomination of a living thing.

We have longed to meet your civilization. We know you were driven from your homeworld by the wretched machines.[BR][BR]We were exiled from our homeworld by the evil Altarians whose very existence is an abomination.
At last you operate in the open. Our people sometimes miss acting as your agents when the need came to it.[BR][BR]Perhaps we can again come to an arrangement.

Welcome, welcome. It can be so hard to find pleasant company. Come, let us share in the small talk of our newly connected Sectors.[BR][BR](Hehehe, by the time they hear of our reputation, we'll have pocketed all their most lucrative information.)
You humans reportedly are no strangers to driving a hard bargain. We look forward to negotiating many profitable deals with you.
Ah more humans. Your species is always surprising to us at how cunning you can be when trading.
We are happy and grateful to have met you. Your knowledge of these Subspace streams had vastly expanded our potential markets.

What a pleasure to meet you. We are a civilization that values things that have inherent value.[BR][BR]If you are ever of the mind of selling your own kind onto the open market, know that there is definitely an opportunity by working with us. Your adorable pelts would fetch a compelling price on the market.
Does your kind trade? We are a corporation looking to profit. Is there profit to be had with you?

Silicon-based lifeforms? Ah. We can offer many beneficial deals to keep you flush with the resources that help your kind grow.[BR][BR](Hopefully, they're not ignorant enough to try and make do without the market.)
The hive welcomes the humans to this part of space.
Our hive has begun to colonize the stars. We have seen many things. But never something quite as striking as you.
You are clearly impressive and distinctive from the other species of the galaxy. Perhaps there is a future for both of us.

Your face looks familiar to us. For many years, our surface world was ruthlessly harvested for precious metals and gems.[BR]We never actually caught the beings who strip-mined our world before we were ready for the stars but you match the description.
The Hive welcomes you. It's interesting to come across another silicon-based life form. We could have much in common.[BR][BR](They look so frail.)
Another animal. We assumed that the vastness of space would result in far more diversity. It is as if the gods were lazy.
You appear different from some of the others. We do not know how to classify your kind.
So the legends are true. Our ancient groves sang of beings such as you that explored worlds.
We are optimistic that we can grow together.
We are glad to finally meet something that isn't an animal. We are not quite sure what you are.
Your reputation for profit over the wellbeing of others is known to us. You will find no welcome ports with us.
Your appearance is brilliant. I hope this first contact can be productive and establish a healthy relationship between our factions.[BR][BR](So help me if the Alliance has soured them to humanity...)
Forgive me if this question is straightforward but recent events have given us cause to change our first contact protocols.[BR][BR]Are your intentions innately hostile or self-serving?
I'll save you the taste of boot and speak first. I represent the Luxar, and yes, I can read your mind. Please be at least vaguely courteous.
Your mind has revealed enough to me. You're a ravaging consumer. Perhaps you can think why I shouldn't consider you an immediate threat.

So that's what's driven your change. Don't worry; your secret is safe with us. All of the other races are far from understanding. It's best not to keep secrets from us; telepathy eventually reveals everything.
Shiny? That's your only impression of us? No, you didn't say that out loud. We can read your mind.
Save your insults; they're less creative than you think. Ah, you've already deduced we can read your mind.
Such anger. Hmmm. You should be warned; we can foresee your tactics inside your mind. Think twice before declaring us your enemy.
You're almost as pleasant as you'd like others to believe you are.
A faction led by Synthetics? Curious.
Your mind is clouded by doctrine. I've telepathically connected with many forms of sentience across the universe, but never anything divine.
Don't dwell on your mistakes. I see you bear tremendous guilt for constructing the Yor, but you'll never be free to thrive till you've rid yourself of that guilt.
Yes, we may be open to trade between our factions. We will have no patience for bad deals, though. We can read your mind and will know if you try to gouge a bargain.
Your mind is so chaotic. Do you frequently juggle that many thoughts at a time? Focusing on fewer things may get you better results. Yes, I can read your mind.
We meet again. Hmmm. You've gotten much better at keeping your thoughts hidden. Regardless, we should have expected you to be among the races to explore these new parts of the universe.
Is all you think about death and war?
Searching your mind is like stepping into an echo chamber of chittering children. I always get left with a migraine.
When did your malformed ilk learn to construct and use a communicator? Have you any need of it? Since when did sentient races make deals with oversized diseases?

We are the Korath! We are the Drengin unafraid to rid the galaxy of repulsive species like you. If you serve us, I'll consider delaying your eradication.[BR][BR]([I]All you sense is a rage without words.[/I])
Your efficiency and resilience are clear to us. We have no love for efforts of destruction, though, and hope for peace.[BR][BR](Keep the mind clear, keep the mind clear, keep the mind clear...)
We see you. We watch you. We learn. We take to space.[BR][BR](We we we we we See see see see see)
[I]The many blinking eyes appear vacant but maintain contact through the display.[/I][BR][BR]([I]The mind of the Irradiated lifeform is a chaotic bubble of unintelligible sounds.[/I])
Our scientists say your day-night cycle last only a handful of hours. That's truly fascinating.
Ah! Apologies and greetings. Your physique resembles ancient predators that plagued our kind. Let's hope for a better relationship.
Early reports indicated you've been long among the stars. There is much we can share.
Your reputation would have us hesitate to offer trust, but we hope to see the good in everyone. How can we help you?
Oh! Our intelligence indicates you have a dedication to neutrality and balance. We share much common ground (metaphorically) -fertile ash for a strong alliance. Shall we talk more?
Greeting. We struggle to see the reason for brutality in this vast expanse filled with light and life. Let's find a brighter future.
Greetings. Tales of your tenacity and determination command respect. Let's see what we can share.
Your glowing eyes and shining exoskeleton are genuinely glorious. We hope to form a strong alliance.
We admire what you've achieved in bringing so many groups together. We remain skeptical of religion but look forward to working together.
We hope that some friendly trade negotiations will lead to much deeper friendships.
Before taking to the stars, we would have never imagined large complex plants, let alone ones that could negotiate.
While we respect your strong will and individuality, no being is a star. We thrive when we work together.
Your efficiency and resilience are clear to us. We have no love for efforts of destruction, though, and hope for peace.
While we hold little hope of alliance, we extend it nonetheless. It's always possible to recognize the strength of differences and collaboration.
You see more than you tell; this we know. Should you decide to share your insight, we'd be happy to listen.
Can you understand us? We have yet to determine if you are a blight or boon to the universe's life.
We are glad to meet you, {LEADERNAME:1}. May our civilizations work together for a better future.
I believe we can work together.
We greet you with a hope to the future.
We hope we can build a mutually beneficial relationship.
We are going to destroy you.
There will never be peace between us.
We will catalog your history after we wipe you out.
We are glad to have finally met.
I think you would find us difficult to digest.
Very well, same back to you.
You can be assured that we were not planning to eat you.
There is a reasonable chance we were not going to eat you.
I think you would give us indigestion.
We hope we are able to work with you.
Oh we love working with criminals.
Greetings. Our relationship depends mostly on whether you will respect our territory.
I suspect we are not going to get along.
Are those screams I hear in the background?
That is not at all ominous.
We have no problem interacting with a machine intelligence.
You have nothing to fear. We have no intention of making you slaves..today.
I can assure you that we are probably maybe not a threat.
That is a shame. We hope to build a better future with you.
You look like a dragon. Has anyone mentioned that?
Well, I do like money. A lot.
We look forward to building a better future with you.
We sense no true hostility from you and hope that it remains so.
An animal? As opposed to what? A plant or mineral? Right... a plant
Let's maintain this hopeful and friendly relationship.
We are glad to finally meet you.
You humans are supposed to be diplomatic. You have failed.
We will unite under my rule.
We are optimistic that we won't need to destroy you.
Don't let our cuteness fool you. We are also adorable.
I suspect it had more to do with ecomorphism.
The future remains to be seen, human.
We shall pluck those cow eyes out of your skull, human.
We are a more perfect version of you.
The flappings of talking meat are irrelevant.
Our destiny is ours. We shall forge it as we see fit.
We look forward to doing business.
We understand if you need some diplomatic training.
We can hear you just fine, and your thoughts are clear -weird is relative.
Do not lay eggs in us.
You would do well to speak diplomatically to us.
Your nature is unimportant to us.
Crass. In the future, let's find something useful to discuss.
You should research more independent ways to reproduce.
We have a natural fear of you. Our ancestors were preyed upon by beings like you.
You are mistaken. We are the ultimate form of life.
Our creators, the Iconians, knew them. We inherited their world.
There will be surprises as long as there are stars.
We can assure you that we are not looking to eat you.
You will find our eggs comforting within your bodies.
We hope to show the universe to you.
We will definitely be killing your kind soon.
We all have to find a way to make a living.
Ha! Truly fascinating how similar forms take different paths throughout the galaxy.
Despite your attitude, we are willing to work with you.
The green hairless mammal has opinions.
You have us to thank for the subspace streams.

As you probably suspect, we will soon be laying our eggs inside your flesh.

We have heard you refer to the Arnor and Dread Lords as the Precursors. We were the first to discover the subspace streams that connect different parts of the galaxy together.[BR][BR]What is not commonly known is that we didn't invent any sort of technology for this per se. They are not an invention but rather a discovery.[BR][BR]The subspace streams are, in fact, a natural phenomenon of the universe. For all we know, there are streams that reach other galaxies entirely.

There are far stranger oddities in the universe than the subspace streams. For instance, there are dimensional gates that travel between different universes entirely.[BR][BR]We once encountered a species from another universe known as the Arilou who came from a universe with its own storied history.

Long after the Precursors disappeared we were satisfied with simply exploring the universe to find the next great wonder.[BR][BR]Unfortunately, there are far worse things in the universe than the species you refer to as the Dread Lords. [BR][BR]The ancient creators, known as the Mithrilar, had experimented on many types of creations before they made the Precursors and not all of those things are gone and some, I am afraid to say, are now awakened.
Long ago, on our world, there were five other sentient species. I suppose you could call them 'Sapient' but who am I to play games with semantics. In any case, we were the only ones to survive.

For us, self-interest is the highest form of morality. You can know, with absolute certainty, that we will be your most loyal friend if it is in our self-interest for you to survive.[BR][BR]Of course, conversely, if it is in our self-interest for you to die, you can be equally assured that you will die.

It has been lost to history but it was our civilization that invented the stargates. [BR][BR]Over two hundred thousand years we invested trillions into the construction of a vast network of stargates.[BR][BR]The stargates allowed ships to travel Hyperspace level 2 between any two of them. This cut down the travel time of a ship traveling 10 lightyears down to only a little over 3 years.[BR][BR]Of course, the proliferation of the Hyperdrive technology allowed individual ships to travel much faster making our efforts obsolete. But for tens of thousands of years, this part of the galaxy was ours.

The other civilizations have not come to the realization that the universe is not only finite but only a small fraction will ever be reachable. [BR][BR]Make no mistake, this galaxy is all we will ever reach.

Our world was called 'Elemental' by the Precursors during their height. [BR][BR]The first off-world proxy war between the two Precursor factions that we called the Dred'nir and Elas'nir was fought on the surface of our planet long before the other species of the galaxy even evolved into their modern form. Yes, that even includes the humans.

We may not exterminate your kind in the immediate future. But eventually there will be a reckoning.[BR][BR]We have made the calculations. The great void sometimes called Bootes void is simply the result of billions of years of Dyson sphere construction hiding the light of countless galaxies. The civilization at the center of that void has already had their singularity.
Our civilization was once a peaceful, preindustrial, aquatic paradise. Then the Drengin came.

We were aware of space travel for centuries. How could we help but not know when raiders were perpetually coming down from the heavens and stealing our offspring?[BR][BR]It was fortunate for us when one of their ships failed to escape the surface of our planet and we learned their secrets.

We do not seek to destroy the Yor simply because they stole our home world. [BR][BR]Contrary to some reports, we did not actually create the Yor. The Precursors ordered us to make them, but the actual spark of life that the Yor have did not come from us.

In a galaxy with such varied species, it is easy to simply stereotype different civilizations based on their most obvious traits. [BR][BR]We are treated like we are greedy. But this isn't true. Our ideology is opportunity. When we trade, we are creating a better universe for our customers as well as for ourselves.

We are not explorers by choice but by necessity.[BR][BR]There is something actively absorbing the life force from all worlds. That is why you find so many dead planets. These worlds weren't always dead.

We look forward to rejoining Earth. But while Earth was trapped behind a Precursor shield for years, our fleet was trapped in a pocket universe of the Precursors making.[BR][BR]We saw things in that pocket universe that we cannot unsee. It wasn't just the Orb of Draginol, the so-called Bane weapon, that came out of that pocket universe with us.
A well informed galaxy is a peaceful galaxy. If you want to know things about others, seek us out.

While we are certainly physically capable of physically crushing any other species, we do our best to avoid actual direct physical violence.[BR][BR]Our kind can only reproduce on our original home world that is now lost to us. While we are long lived, we are not immortal nor are indestructible.

There is a misunderstanding that THE WAY is a religion based on faith. It is not. [BR][BR]We are a collection of species that have had direct, physical contact with a being of such immense glory, whose plan for the universe is so sublime, that we feel obligated to bring others into this holy cause.
The time is coming where we civilizations with the same philosophy must unite together to destroy those who would stand against us.
Soon, {LEADERNAME:2}, the galaxy will unite one way or the other.
We are pleased with the ideological path you have chosen thus far. Benevolence is the path of the righteous.
Resisting the temptation of evil is not always easy. But it will help us all build a better galaxy.
The universe is dark enough without adding to it, {LEADERNAME:2}. We are pleased with the path you have taken so far.
You impress us, {LEADERNAME:2}. Your understanding that the weak are fodder for the strong has won you respect with us.

Is it kinder to allow the weak to continue to suffer a state of existence? Or to end their pain by exterminating them? Based on your actions, {LEADERNAME:2}, it would seem you agree with us. The weak must be exterminated.
What, exactly, are you supposed to be? Some sort of rock-based worm species?
It is hard to believe that a silicon-based life form naturally evolved. Are you sure you are natural?
The {PLAYERFACTION:2} should have stayed in the sewers of their home world, {LEADERNAME:2}. There is very little water in space.
The vacuum of space is no place for the likes of you, {LEADERNAME:2} . You should return to the oceans of your home world.
The {PLAYERFACTION:2} and {PLAYERFACTION:1} will crush our mutual enemies together! We look forward to torturing them and their pets!
It is a shame we find ourselves in a time of galactic war. But with you fighting our mutual enemy we believe victory is certain.

Be wary who you trade with. If you want to be our friend, do not trade with those who have despicable ideologies.
You should be aware that you are trading with a civilization whose culture represents everything we are against.

We are getting a lot of reports from our people regarding the ease of working with your people.
The open borders treaty that exists between our peoples has greatly improved commerce and relations between our citizens and yours.
The open borders treaty has made navigation in this sector much easier. Thank you.
Soon, your worlds will be ours.
If you surrender now, we will show mercy.
Your planets are ripe for conquest. Even now, my military advisors are urging me to take action.
Your military is so weak that it is a miracle you haven't already been conquered.
As much as we love capitalism, we do not appreciate you intentionally trying to incite our people to join you. Remove your starbases, or else.
Our mutual trade continues to strengthen our relationship.
We are finding that our trading relationship is building a sense of trust between our people.
Our shared borders are making my advisors irritable. Make sure you stay on your side.

There is tension due to our close borders. An open borders treaty would alleviate this.
You should be aware that our military is quite annoyed with your starbase. You should negotiate an open borders treaty with us.
While we do not plan to attack your ships that trespass, be aware that they cause us some consternation. If you want to travel through our zone of influence, negotiate an open borders treaty.
We have concerns about your armed ships traveling near our worlds without an open borders treaty.
If you want to maintain good relations with us, then don't send armed ships into our space without an open borders treaty.
We do not appreciate having military vessels traveling into our space without a treaty.
Our ultimate goal is to conquer the galaxy. When we ultimately consume you, we want you to know that it wasn't personal.
Our people desire for galactic conquest.
You colonized a planet within our zone of influence. We won't necessarily go to war over that, but don't be surprised if the people of that world ultimately decide to join us.
What exactly is your long-term plan? My military advisors tell me that your civilization would be safer under our rule, given your lack of military power.
Have you considered giving your worlds to us? Your people would be much safer under our protection.
Your lack of military power is making you an easy target for would-be conquerors.
Your worlds...so poorly defended. So ripe for conquest.
We appreciate your pacifism. It will make your eventual conquest that much easier.
You have no idea how fortunate you are that we are busy with other things. Your pitiful military and rich worlds are calling to us. Do you understand?
Your people are calling upon us to learn the proper way to live.
There is so much blasphemy on your worlds. It may soon be time to bring a proper moral order to them.
Your people call out for redemption from their sins. We may be the instrument of their salvation.
Your worlds are full of beings ripe for the feeding. You are like cattle waiting to be slaughtered.
Your planets are so tempting to us. Our shock troops can be a bit sadistic, but in time, I suspect you will come to appreciate them.

[I]Immitate a shrugging gesture with a few tentacles.[/I]
[I]Hold out a stone of nearly incomprehensible color.[/I] [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Trade)[/COLOR]
[I]There's a moment of silence. Even with the Universal Translator, communicating verbally appears impossible. The creature seems relaxed, tentacles waving at the screen.[/I]
You are quite possibly the most disturbing thing I have ever seen. I'm sure you get that a lot.
Now, how did you- You're not one of our larvas.
Salutations? We hope you are open to friendly diplomatic relations.
If you're not edible and don't make good slaves, then you'll be happy to know we'll probably destroy you last.
We will try to show you the same respect all life, and we hope you'll prove more sentient than you look.
As foul and astray as you appear, accept The Way, and we may manage your salvation.
Are you familiar with the laws of economics? If not, we'd happily induct you into the interstellar market.
Are you some form of befouled root system?
Oh! You're, ummm, interesting. I represent the Terran Resistance. Let's find some common ground.
When did your malformed ilk learn to construct and use a communicator? Have you any need of it? Since when did sentient races make deals with oversized diseases?
I have boots more threatening than you. Squirm away on your rotting worlds, and I might delay your extermination.
[I]The organism on the screen before you squirms like some deeply discomforting nightmare.[/I]
[I]The flailing creature on the screen resembles a larva if you ignore the haphazard growth of appendages and eyes.[/I]
[I]The revolting worm-like creature dares to try and make eye contact.[/I]
[I]The organic life before you does not match any currently understood evolutionary trend. Mute == true.[/I]
[I]Even as diverse as the oceans are, nothing quite like the creature undulating on screen has been recorded before.[/I]
[I]A mass of organic matter shifts about on the screen. It fails to produce sound but makes many nondescript motions with various appendages and eyes.[/I]
[I]A few sharp movements couple the silence of the indecipherable alien on the screen.[/I]
[I]The flailing lifeform before you looks soft, weak, and (most revoltingly) like it'd taste horrible.[/I]
[I]Before you is an Irradiated, a race that makes up the Cosmic Contaminant. Beyond their presence in the galaxy, very little is known beyond they can not verbally communicate.[/I]
Umm, hello? Let's try to get along, I guess.
[I]Wave a few tentacles at the screen.[/I]
[I]Squirm in a way that imitates nodding.[/I]
[I]Wave a tentacle in dismissal of the brute.[/I]
[I]Hold up a few shiny objects in affirmation.[/I]
Well. This meeting has been eventful.
I can't possibly tell if you're groveling or not.
What extreme circumstances must have produced you.
Come, learn The Way. There is absolution for all.
Per first contact protocol: Greetings, we come in peace.
The nicest thing I can say is you're a waste of my time.
We hope that we may understand each other over time.
[I]Maintain intense eye contact till surreptitiously closing the Incoming Message.[/I]
The less I have to see of you, the better.
[I]Wave a dismissive tentacle at the screen.[/I]
[I]Curl a threatening tentacle at the screen.[/I]
[I]Roll eyes before waving dismissively at the screen.[/I]
[I]Maintain distasteful eye contact till they hang up.[/I]
[I]Stare at the screen to instill discomfort.[/I]
[I]Angrily throw the closest loose object at the screen.[/I]
Your warm squirming mass is perfect for our eggs.
Utterly foul. Do not try to contact me again.
There is something profoundly discomforting about looking at you.
Stay clear of The Way, and we'll extend mercy.
Per the possible parasitic lifeform addendum: This is your warning.
Riding the universe of your weakness should be easy enough.
We have yet to determine whether you are truly dangerous.
[I]The lifeform crushes something small in one of its tentacles. They just conquered one of your worlds.[/I]
[I]The squirming lifeform throws something at the screen, maintaining an intense glower.[/I][BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](We are at war)[/COLOR]
[I]Throw a pile of sludge at the screen.[/I]
[I]The mass of organic matter on the screen holds out a scrap of something white, seeming to ask for an end to the ongoing conflict.[/I]
[I]Hold up a tentacle to signal agreement.[/I]
[I]Squirm to indicate discomfort with the current terms but avoid complete disagreement.[/I]
[I]Writhe in mock laughter to downright refuse the request.[/I]
[I]A loose object is tossed to the side before appendages flailed threateningly, the offer refused.[/I]
[I]The Irradiated lifeform stares at the screen patiently.[/I]
[I]The entity on screen frantically writhes, glancing about manically. What few appendages it spares wave you away.[/I]

[I]The entity on screen angrily writhes, frantic in their erratic motions and behavior. They're quite preoccupied with the Everwar. In the short time it's on-screen several indiscernible items are thrown at the screen.[/I]
[I]The entity on screen jostles in what could generously be called laughter. It waves a dismissive tentacle, refusing to help now that the galaxy has turned on you.[/I]
[I]The entity on-screen looks shocked and confused, at least as close as it can, given its appearance. It gestures widely around. They're just as preoccupied with the apocalypse as anyone.[/I]
[I]Shakes angrily at the screen, the trade unacceptable.[/I]
[I]The mute alien waves happily at the screen after accepting the trade offer.[/I]
[I]Stares patiently at the screen awaiting your offer.[/I]
[I]The Irradiated lifeform stares at the screen patiently.[/I]
[I]The Irradiated lifeform stares at the screen patiently.[/I]
[I]Gestures broadly at some new items added to the trade.[/I]
[I]Make the most threatening gesture you can think of; surely they'll understand it means war![/I]

[I]The lifeform glowers at the screen, the intense gaze filling with anger.[/I]

[I]The lifeform barely makes eye contact, a dismissive tentacle indicating a lack of interest in communicating.[/I]
[I]The entity on screen responds with deeply discomforting movements.[/I]
[I]The entity on screen writhes in anger, tentacles curling in a clear threat.[/I]
[I]Perform a typical gesture of aggression that probably doesn't translate.[/I]
[I]Stare astutely at the screen to instill a deep discomfort.[/I]
[I]Adjust behavior sharply to seem relaxed, avoiding instigating war at the last moment.[/I]
[I]Wave several dismissive, joking tentacles to avoid instigating a war.[/I]

Greetings, {LEADERNAME:2}. As a civilization living in the shadow of the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1}, it would be proper for you to provide us with {AMOUNT:2} credits as a showing of respect.
{LEADERNAME:2}, it's time you admit the might of the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1}. We demand {AMOUNT:2} credits from your pathetic civilization.
Consider it a tithe of {AMOUNT:2} credits for your devotion to our cause.
Expenses are on the rise and we will need an additional {AMOUNT:2} credits from you.
Very well, the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} will give you what you want, for now.
Our race has an infinite memory. We will not forget this veiled threat.
Your civilization forced us to pay before. We paid. But it did not end well for you.
Making me give you stuff for free isn't going to make us less angry. But death won't either. So fine, take it.
You have the advantage now. But when you live as my slaveling we will revisit this day.
The {PLAYERFACTION:2} will not be pushed around... and the magnitude of your might is questionable.
I'm going to bet you're not serious.
As an civilization of great power, it is only appropriate for the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1} to receive tribute from the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2}... let's say to the tune of {AMOUNT:2} credits per month?
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} will comply with this request, for now.
Great power? Don't be ridiculous; hit the road, {LEADERNAME:1}.
Wrong answer. I'm sure you'll see the consequences of your mistake soon enough.

Despite our prodigious strength compared to the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2}, we find you do have knowledge that we still lack. Give us information about {TECHNAME:2}, and we may overlook the temptation to take advantage of your relative weakness.
Very well, the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} will give you what you want, for now.
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} will not be pushed around... and the magnitude of your might is questionable.
We are being attacked by the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. Please, {LEADERNAME:2}, help us out by giving us {AMOUNT:2} credits.
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} has its own problems. No.
Our defenses are under assault by the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}, and we desperately need your assistance, {LEADERNAME:2}. Could you supply us with {TECHNAME:2}?
We are deeply grateful for your generosity and swift action, {LEADERNAME:2}. Your willingness to share {TECHNAME:2} with us in our time of need is truly appreciated.
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} has its own problems. No.

The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} has launched an assault against us, and our circumstances are critical, {LEADERNAME:2}. Our only hope for survival lies in your declaration of war against the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}.

We understand the gravity of your situation, and we stand with you. We will declare war on the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} and join forces to ensure your survival. Together, we will face this threat and emerge victorious.
Your support in this dire situation is invaluable, {LEADERNAME:2}. We are truly grateful for your commitment to stand with us against the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. Together, we shall triumph.

As members of the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1}, we implore you to assist us in our conflict with the treacherous {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. In gratitude for your partnership, we propose a generous reward of {AMOUNT:1} credits. Will you unite with us in this endeavor?

We, the representatives of {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1}, reach out to you with a request for your aid in the struggle against the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. Your support would be invaluable, and we promise {AMOUNT:1} credits in compensation for your services. Will you stand with us?

On behalf of the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1}, we entreat you to lend us your strength against the formidable {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. We pledge to reward your valor with {AMOUNT:1} credits, should you agree to stand by our side. Will you join us in this battle?
We will declare war on the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} for the benefit of both of our civilizations.
I knew we could count on you. Thank you!
We can't go to war at this time.

I'm sure you agree that the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} is a blight on this galaxy. Rise up to your responsibility and declare war on them; we will provide {AMOUNT:1} credits to remove any concern of expense.
We will declare war on the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. We stand together.
We are not interested in being mercenaries for your benefit, {LEADERNAME:1}.
You will be forced to take a side soon enough, then you will wish you had taken our generous offer.

The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1} comes to you with an opportunity: The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} are a menace. We believe preemptive action is the best path to prevent them from becoming an overwhelming threat.[BR][BR]However, we are not currently in a position to deal with them. Therefore, if you declare war on them, we will give you the knowledge of {TECHNAME:1} to aid in your fight.

Through your creative use of guns, ships and ships with guns, you have put your boot on the galaxy's neck. All of your enemies have been crushed, their planets beaten into submission, and their citizens made to wave your flag. It wasn't pretty, but it never had to be, did it?

Your culture has spread across the entire galaxy. Aliens everywhere are seeking to emulate the ways of your people, adding or removing limbs as necessary to better fit their vision of the perfect life you lead. Who needs to conquer the bodies when you already own their hearts and minds?

Using your powerful brains, your culture has unlocked the secrets of not only this universe, but the one beyond. Let the simpletons of the galaxy squabble over the dust and fragments of rock they squat upon. For your people, something far greater beckons.

Your study of the ways of the Precursors is complete, and your people will soon be indistinguishable from the Precursors themselves. Having mastered their technology and way of thinking, your people are about to set out on a journey that the lesser minds of this galaxy cannot even begin to comprehend.

Another race has followed the path of the Precursors and ascended. Though our destruction is not immediate, you have led us to become evolutionary obsolete. Our spaceships and lasers have little meaning to a race beyond mortality, to whom time and space are children's toys. To them, we aren't even truly sentient, we are dust blowing around the galaxy, ignored or destroyed as their whims dictate.

And with the stroke of a pen, peace was finally at hand. A peace that would last, for it had been laid on a foundation of mutual trust and respect. With their minds and resources no longer wasted on the unending thirst of war, a new golden age of prosperity soon descends upon your people and its allies.

For years, your people fought and struggled on the galactic stage with your ambitious and conniving neighbors. Although no single race ever gained a decisive edge, when the conflict turned into a war of attrition, it was your people who ultimately ended in the best position.

For years, your people fought and struggled on the galactic stage with your ambitious and conniving neighbors. Although no single race ever gained a decisive edge, when the conflict turned into a war of attrition, it was your people who ultimately ended in the best position.

And with that, your civilization collapsed. For a time, your people lived on, scattered around the galaxy as refugees and hermits. But your species' power never returned. Will your people be remembered in museums and textbooks, or wiped from the memories of all beings? You'll never know. It's not up to you to say anymore.

Building a galaxy spanning civilization takes a long time, and not everyone has the patience for it. Will your people understand that you did the best you could, or will they curse you for abandoning them while aliens devour their bones? Don't let it keep you up at night (you should let it keep you up at night).

A smooth-skinned biped stares back at us from the view screen. Wearing some kind of lightly ceremonial garb, it jabbers a short series of unintelligible grunting sounds. Getting no response from us, it gestures at someone off screen in a manner which suggests annoyance. They can't seem to understand us either.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

Our screen flickers for a minute before the video emerges, filled with an image of a massive insectoid creature. [BR][BR]Motionless at first, its only a slight waver of its vicious pincers which indicate the creature is alive as it glares back at us. In the background, more of its kind move around, clicking and chittering at each other. A language of some kind, but it's impossible to determine what they're saying.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A curious creature stares back at us from the screen. Ten or twelve legged, in the manner of a segmented insect, the creature also appears to have a lightly armored exoskeleton.[BR][BR]From its long, dexterous tongue, a series of subtle hissing noises emerges. It seems to be trying to communicate with us, but it's of no use.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A small, furry creature appears on screen. With its soft fur and enormous eyes, the being looks cute, and possibly delicious. Its eyes widen even further, perhaps realizing what we're thinking.[BR][BR]Eventually it opens its small, delicate mouth and emits a series of mewling noises. A speech of sorts, though who knows what it means. Something adorable, no doubt.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A green skinned biped appears on screen, wearing elaborate clothes and a headdress. Likely a female, if this species has the same notion of genders as we do, which may be a dangerous guess.[BR][BR] The creature utters something in their native tongue, unintelligible, yet somehow very, very compelling.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A ferocious looking humanoid fills the screen, glaring at you from behind green eyes. You can feel the contempt dripping from him, though he says nothing.[BR][BR]It murmurs something, almost below the range of hearing, and flicker of strange text crosses the screen, as the alien's communications systems try and fail to interface with ours. There will be no talking with this creature today.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A cruel looking green skinned biped appears, glaring at us. Wearing armor of some kind, and baring its teeth, it gives every impression that it is a warrior, or at least wishes to be perceived as one.[BR][BR]It barks something angrily at the screen, and you wonder for a moment if it's truly a bad thing we can't understand what its saying.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A slender, blue skinned biped appears, delicate in feature and manner. It speaks calmly at us in a strange yet somehow noble speech.[BR][BR]Seeing no recognition in our response, it nods its head slowly, having realized the communication barrier that exists. If anything, it seems disappointed in us.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A metallic creature appears on screen, unblinking red sensors staring back at us. The sensors iris open a bit, before narrowing, the creature studying us.[BR][BR]Sound emerges from it, a clash of discordant sounds, almost as if its trying different languages on us to see if we understand anything. We don't. The sensors narrow even further. There's no point communicating with this being now.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A small biped appears on screen, staring at us. It has a wide, flat skull, and large eyes which seem to avoid making eye contact with us. Perhaps a side effect of the communication system.[BR][BR]It murmurs at us for a time in a language devoid of sharp consonant sounds, but no meaning really comes through. We'll have to converse with this strange creature another time.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A being in much the same shape as a crustacean wobbles cheerfully on our view screen, a jumble of eyes and legs. A gentle shimmer suggests the creature - and its kin working behind him - are underwater at the moment.[BR][BR]The creature clicks and snaps its claws in our direction, no doubt trying to say something. Hard to say what it could be at this point.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A tall bipedal alien appears on screen with a distinct, ridged skull. The being has six eyes, spread widely across its face, which all pivot to look at us.[BR][BR]Has it seen our kind before, or are we as much of a mystery to them as they are to us? It says something, quick and repetitive, almost a chant. A ritual greeting perhaps? But there's no making sense of it.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

An alien appears on the view screen, likely bipedal, with a long, narrow skull and slender tendrils appearing from the mouth area.[BR][BR]Small eyes towards the top of the skull narrow as it says something. The tone of the language suggests a question, though we can't understand it. The alien sways gently, sensing the futility of further communication.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A strange bipedal alien appears on screen, with lizard-like, even draconid qualities. The crested ridges above its eyes flex, as it leans in to study us from its perch in an ornate looking room.[BR][BR]A deep growling voice emerges from somewhere deep within it, the mouth barely moving. A pleasant greeting or dire threat, we can't be sure.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A gray skinned hominoid alien peers back at us from the view screen. The alien has four eyes, and a thin smile which gives the impression of friendliness, though that may be a dangerous assumption.[BR][BR]Behind the creature, a clean, even sterile looking spaceship can be seen. Some words are exchanged, but nothing can be understood between you and them. The thin smile remains though. All in good time, it would seem.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A tall hominoid alien appraises us from the view screen. Although bipedal, the segmented section of its neck suggests perhaps an annelid biology.[BR][BR]Whatever its origin, the being tries a few words in its native tongue, a strange combination of rumbles and rhythmic vibrations, though nothing can be understood from it. The alien seems bemused by our speech as well.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A strange plantlike creature appears on screen. Bark like skin covers its trunk and surprisingly humanoid looking face, before giving way to sleek, well maintained foliage further up.[BR][BR]In the background, a decidedly organic, plant-like ship can be seen. The creature emits a series of long, creaking groans, evidently trying to communicate with us. No sense can be made of it, for now.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

A glimmering creature appears on the screen, its body formed of blue crystal with wide intelligent eyes. As beautiful as it is, your awe at seeing it is not reflected in its face, which instead looks sympathetic or disgusted.[BR][BR]There is a brief pause as the creature considers you and you almost hear voices, like memories echoing distantly in your mind. But you cannot tell what they say, or if they are coming from the alien. Disappointed the creature hums softly in almost musical tones. It is beautiful, but equally indecipherable. [BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

The incoming message comes with the visage of a slender alien covered naturally in fuzz and chitin. Large compound eyes blink quickly and frequently.[BR][BR]A series of melodic hissing clicks comes from the being. After a short pause, another series of sounds come through the speakers, coupled with soft hand motions. Without a means to decipher the message, proper communication is unachievable.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)
"We have no pressing ship construction needs right now."
"We should construct more military ships to aid in our war efforts."
"Our military is weak. We should increase military ship production so we do not appear to be easy targets."
"Our colonies could use more protection from stationed ships."
"We should build colony ships to claim additional worlds into our civilization."
"Much of the galaxy remains a mystery to us. We should build some probes to learn about our surroundings."
"There are anomalies we could be surveying, if we had more survey ships at our disposal."
"We should build more constructor ships, so that we can use starbases to expand our control."

Newly discovered records reveal the Navigators' desperate attempt to halt the Drengin's rapid growth by concealing subspace stream entrances, shedding light on the past struggle for galactic stability and the race to develop countermeasures against this formidable threat.

The once-prominent Thalan Empire has mysteriously vanished from the galactic scene after nearly a century of influence, leaving the interstellar community puzzled and searching for answers to their sudden disappearance.
